elements.title: a 10-foot-tall (3 m) chicken (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a 10-foot-tall (3 m) chicken (pictured) stands on a roundabout in Dorking, Surrey?

elements.title: REI union (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that on March 2, 2022, 86 percent of workers in New York City's REI store voted in favor of the outdoor recreation retailer's first ever trade union, REI union SoHo?

elements.title: Abhijātābhivaṃsa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Abhijātābhivaṃsa, 12th recipient of the title of Tipiṭakadhara Dhammabhaṇḍāgārika, could memorize and recite all the pages of the Tipiṭaka?

elements.title: raptor persecution (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that raptor persecution is a crime against birds of prey, and in Scotland, ravens are afforded honorary raptor status?

elements.title: Charlie Cytron-Walker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the Colleyville synagogue hostage crisis, rabbi Charlie Cytron-Walker threw a chair at the perpetrator?

elements.title: Falklands Maritime Heritage Trust (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Falklands Maritime Heritage Trust, which found the wreck of Endurance in 2022, also discovered the wreck of SMS Scharnhorst in 2019?

elements.title: Victoria Brownworth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Victoria Brownworth was the first open lesbian to write a column in a daily newspaper in the United States?

elements.title: "boots" theory (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to the "boots" theory, poverty is more expensive than being rich?
